meanings.definition: A faculty by which the body perceives an external stimulus
meanings.sent1: Using my sense of touch, I could feel the softness of the fabric.
meanings.sent2: She had a sense that someone was watching her.
meanings.sent3: It didn't make sense to wear a winter coat in the summer.
meanings.sent4: His sixth sense told him to avoid the dark alley.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread filled the room, creating a sense of warmth and comfort.

meanings.definition: A feeling that something is the case
meanings.sent1: I had a sense of excitement when I saw the presents under the tree.
meanings.sent2: Her sense of relief was palpable when she found her lost keys.
meanings.sent3: It made sense to bring an umbrella when the sky looked cloudy.
meanings.sent4: His sense of dread grew as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The sense of accomplishment after finishing the race was overwhelming.

meanings.sent1: His sense of direction led us safely through the forest.
meanings.sent2: She showed great sense in choosing the most cost-effective option.
meanings.sent3: It didn't make sense to spend all her money on unnecessary items.
meanings.sent4: His sense of responsibility made him a reliable employee.
meanings.sent5: The sense of urgency in his voice made everyone act quickly.
